sentence.Network_en: They hone for the farm life.
At this time, Stewart began to hone and develop her business skills.

sentence.Network_en: Once you hone your communication skills, you'll see results.
sentence.Network_cn: 一旦您完善了你的沟通技巧, 你会看到结果.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old English hān 'stone', of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse hein

entry.tran: 磨炼（技能）;开发（产品）；锤炼（观点）
entry.def: If you hone something, for example a skill, technique, idea, or product, you carefully develop it over a long period of time so that it is exactly right for your purpose.

example.ex: Leading companies spend time and money on honing the skills of senior managers...
example.tran: 龙头公司会在磨砺高层管理人员的技能上付出时间和金钱。

example.ex: His body is honed and kept in trim with constant exercise.
example.tran: 他经常运动，以锻炼身体和保持身材。

entry.def: If you hone a blade, weapon, or tool, you sharpen it on a stone or with a special device.

example.ex: ...four grinding wheels for honing fine edged tools and implements.
example.tran: 4个珩磨带有锋利刀刃的工具的砂轮

means.word_mean: 1. a whetstone made of fine gritstone; used for sharpening razors
